intro: Rotala congolensis, commonly known as the African waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Pontederiaceae family and is characterized by its whorled arrangement of leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow water or wetland environments, making it an important component of aquatic ecosystems. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Rotala congolensis is also used in ornamental gardening due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in moist conditions.
